body.p: Conrefs will help you in the long run to save time! With LwDITA, you can only use conrefs when referencing lists (ordered, unordered, and their items), paragraphs, sections, and tables.
Let's work step-by-step with including a conref in your LwDITA content.

ol.li: Let's say there is a certain concept you want to include in different sections of your content (the commonly referenced concept is usually a warning or troubleshooting of some sort). First, create a concept that you will reference in a different topic.

Once you finish writing all of the information that you want to conref, now it's time to look at your code. In the third line, create a unique ID for your concept. If you are writing about a warning within your concept, maybe your ID could look like this: <concept id="warning">
Next, in the paragraph element of your content, create an ID for the actual information you provide. If your warning is about a deadline, for instance, your element would look like this:

Now go to the topic in which you want your conref displayed. Wherever you want your conref displayed, create a new section with a paragraph. In the paragraph's element, type conref=[insert concept ID here without brackets].dita#[insert concept ID here without brackets]/[insert paragraph ID here without brackets]
Finally, check in author mode if your information from your concept is displayed in your topic.
